programme.desc: Cherif: Created by Lionel Olenga, Stéphane Drouet, Laurent Scalese. With Abdelhafid Metalsi, Greg Germain, François Bureloup, Vincent Primault. The adventures and misadventures of the always-smiling Kader Cherif, Captain of Lyons' Criminal Brigade with an eccentric way to solve the cases, and his by-the-book new partner, Adeline Briard." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt2707504/","name":"Cherif","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjQ4MmVkZmQtYWY3NC00Nzc2LTk3MTgtZWQ4NDQ4MTY2MzkyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDEwOTk0NTk@._V1_.jpg","description":"The adventures and misadventures of the always-smiling Kader Cherif, Captain of Lyons' Criminal Brigade with an eccentric way to solve the cases, and his by-the-book new partner, Adeline Briard.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2707504/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"MACEDAO"},"dateCreated":"2021-02-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"One of the best","reviewBody":"I just love this serie, is in my top 10 and is wonderful the development of the relationship between Cherif and Adeline, they make me laugh a lot and is pleasant the way Cherif uses humor and tv shows to solve crimes, looking like a light and humored version of CSI that I love too. programme.desc: Deputy: Created by Will Beall. With Stephen Dorff, Yara Martinez, Brian Van Holt, Bex Taylor-Klaus. Sibyl: Directed by Justine Triet. With Virginie Efira, Adèle Exarchopoulos, Gaspard Ulliel, Sandra Hüller. A jaded psychotherapist returns to her first passion of becoming a writer." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt9173264/","name":"Sibyl","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDY3MmQ3NzMtYTUxMi00ZWQzLThjNmYtNmE5MjUyYTU1MGRmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTMxODk2OTU@._V1_.jpg","description":"A jaded psychotherapist returns to her first passion of becoming a writer.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt9173264/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"FrenchEddieFelson"},"dateCreated":"2019-05-26","inLanguage":"English","name":"An ersatz of Providence","reviewBody":"The trailer was classically misleading. I did not expect a pale remake of Providence (1977) directed by Alain Resnais.

In short: 1) Sibyl has a few undisclosed skeletons in the closet and manages them while drinking abusively. 2) Sibyl is a shrink and the border between her private life and her professional life does not exist. 3) Sibyl is a writer and she draws inspiration from her own surroundings. Thus, given these three points, fiction and reality are quickly confused, for Sibyl first and for the audience even more.

Although the actresses Sandra Hüller and Adèle Exarchopoulos are outstanding, this story of a lost woman suffering of emotional distress is globally boring.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":4}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":2725,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.8},"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2019-05-24","keywords":"nudity,female nudity,bare breasts,sex scene,one word title","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Sibyl","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3410673177","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTgzMmNhN2UtOWQ4MC00NGE1LTkzZTEtNmUzZTE3N2U3MDExXkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTgzMmNhN2UtOWQ4MC00NGE1LTkzZTEtNmUzZTE3N2U3MDExXkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Official Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1812637/","name":"Virginie Efira"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2650819/","name":"Adèle Exarchopoulos"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0880484/","name":"Gaspard Ulliel"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2630323/","name":"Justine Triet"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0275730/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0056755/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0258767/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1932959/","name":"Arthur Harari"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1797444/","name":"David H. programme.title: To, co zostaje
programme.desc: Marianna (Marta Ścisłowicz) i Jan (Piotr Czarniecki) wiodą szczęśliwe życie na wsi w północno-wschodniej Polsce. Pewnego dnia kobieta musi stawić czoła niespodziewanej śmierci męża. Wyrzuty sumienia i nagła strata sprawiają, że potrzebuje czasu, żeby pożegnać ukochanego. Zamyka się z jego ciałem w domu. Jej zachowanie spotyka się z niezrozumieniem mieszkańców wioski.

credits.actor: Marta Ścisłowicz

programme.title: Wyzwania
programme.desc: Joanna (Jenna Coleman) i Alistair (Ewen Leslie) są małżeństwem wychowującym razem dziecko w nadmorskim australijskim miasteczku. Pewnego dnia ktoś niepostrzeżenie uprowadza ich potomka. Zrozpaczeni i rozgoryczeni rodzice muszą zmierzyć się z tą tragedią, lecz ich związek chwieje się w posadach. Brytyjski serial opowiadający o dekonstrukcji relacji między żoną i mężem, dotykający także kwestii macierzyństwa i rodzicielstwa.

credits.actor: Jenna Coleman, Ewen Leslie, Asher Keddie, Shareena Clanton, Alex Dimitriades, Stella Gonet, Markella Kavenagh, Sophie Kennedy Clark, Kate Dickie

programme.title: Place Vendôme
Plac Vendome
Place Vendôme
programme.desc: Place Vendôme: Directed by Nicole Garcia. With Catherine Deneuve, Jean-Pierre Bacri, Emmanuelle Seigner, Jacques Dutronc. Realising a dishonest deal has been found out a diamond merchant commits suicide, leaving the gems in question for his wife. Knowing the business from the time before drink largely took over her life, she decides to sober up and sell them herself. Though they attract much interest, no-one legitimate will touch them. As she tries to get her present life straight the lure of the stones means she may have to confront the past as well." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0119901/","name":"Place Vendôme","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTc4NjY3MDAyM15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwNzEwOTg5._V1_.jpg","description":"Realising a dishonest deal has been found out a diamond merchant commits suicide, leaving the gems in question for his wife. programme.title: L'ordre des médecins
Zawód: Lekarz
L'Ordre des médecins
programme.desc:
L'ordre des médecins: Directed by David Roux. With Jérémie Renier, Marthe Keller, Zita Hanrot, Maud Wyler. At the age of 37, Simon is a seasoned doctor, who works with death every day in his department of pneumology. As a good professional, he learned to protect himself. But when her mother is hospitalized in critical condition in a nearby service, the intimate and the professional telescope. All of Simon's world, all his certainties and beliefs are flickering." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8886110/","name":"L'ordre des médecins","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTVjOTVlNjktZWRjOS00MmQyLTgwYjgtZDUyZTQ2M2MwNDgxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTc5OTQwMzk@._V1_.jpg","description":"At the age of 37, Simon is a seasoned doctor, who works with death every day in his department of pneumology. As a good professional, he learned to protect himself. But when her mother is hospitalized in critical condition in a nearb","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8886110/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"dbdumonteil"},"dateCreated":"2019-11-26","inLanguage":"English","name":"My mummy is gonna die......","reviewBody":"If there is still any doubt that Mr Jérémie Rénier is one of the European 's greatest actors , see "l'Ordre Des Médecins ", a first effort by Mr David Roux , a masterstoke ;taking a subject as old as the hills (a mother dying in a hospital where his son is a seasoned lung specialist ) ,Roux avoids sentimentalism and pathos ,achieving a delicate balance between an almost documentary approach and an unusually human compassion ; many scenes come to mind : after the end (not shown on the screen) ,father and son desperately embrace each other in a dark room;the terminally-ill mom,saying her life has been a fullfilled one and that she can go;her last words spoken could be "all is well ,all is peace" ;the sequence when the whole family savors ice-creams in the garden echoes it ("isn't lemon taste wonderful,mom? and just have a taste of apricot") the young doctor, bursting into tears after saving a patient .

Jeremie Rénier,since his breakthrough with Ozon's disturbing "Les Amants Criminels" (1999),has proved he was able to play anything: from the last ,lonely and wretched guy ("L'Enfant" by the Dardenne bros ) to a pop singer ("Clo-Clo" )to self-assured lung specialist facing a situation which undermines the fondations of his world;a world which is not rosy every day : the scene in which Rénier took my breath away is when he scolds a young intern who has just said to a young patient suffering from mucovisdicosis that they would save her : and in spite of his ruthless words ,Rénier achieves the incredible feat of remaining endearing to the audience .

Matching him every step of the way is Marthe Keller's portrayal of a dying mother ;co-incidentally ,miss Keller had ,some forty years ago ,portrayed a terminally-ill woman opposite Al Pacino in "Bobby Deefield";she shows here that, unlike some her colleagues lost in the current "feel good" French scene,she can age gracefully.;spare of words and gestures ,she expresses everything with her looks.

But whereas the patient remains resigned to her fate, the husband does not accept it: "I'm fifteen years her senior,I should have gone first!" or " I 'd like best your mom to be in your service ,I'd be easier in my mind ";terse answer by the son: "it wouldn't make a difference".

And much to Roux' s credit ,no song in English ,as it is often the case with his "trendy " colleagues. Joe Dassin' s "C'Est La Vie Lily " provides the movie with one of his rare playful moments; "Donne-Moi La Main" is the equivalent of the poster ,the man with bright prospects who for the first time in his career needs a helping hand and who feels helpless and lonely in his tragedy .

Yes ,Mister Roux will be a name to be reckoned with,in the years to come.I would highly recommend this work,but only for people with a strong heart.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":244,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.3},"genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2019-01-23","keywords":"doctor,hospital,death,radiography,telephone call","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Bande-annonce [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1026538009","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDc3ZjllMWYtOTFlZi00YTA2LWE2YjctZDI4ZmUwNjU5YWQ1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDc3ZjllMWYtOTFlZi00YTA2LWE2YjctZDI4ZmUwNjU5YWQ1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0753737/","name":"Jérémie Renier"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0445715/","name":"Marthe Keller"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1581208/","name":"Zita Hanrot"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0746196/","name":"David Roux"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0342973/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0482351/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0244390/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1701553/","name":"Julie Peyr"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0746196/","name":"David Roux"}],"duration":"PT1H33M"}</script><metacontent="

Charter
programme.desc: Charter: Directed by Amanda Kernell. With Ane Dahl Torp, Sverrir Gudnason, Troy Lundkvist, Tintin Poggats Sarri. After a divorce, Alice hasn't seen her children in two months as she awaits a custody verdict. When her son calls her in the middle of the night, Alice takes action, abducting the children on an illicit charter trip to the Canary Islands." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt9850050/","name":"Charter","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDlmYzJhZjQtYWQxZi00NWY4LTlmZmEtYTM5MWQzZTVmZmE0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTEyNzI4ODY3._V1_.jpg","description":"After a divorce, Alice hasn't seen her children in two months as she awaits a custody verdict. Dialogues were dull, plot was not interesting, couldn't relate to any character or felt for any of them.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":4040,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.3},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2018-09-27","keywords":"long take,austro hungarian empire,female protagonist,anarchism,prostitution","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2984098329","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjU4MzY0ODMtYmI1NS00NmZiLTllYjYtMjhjZTliODk1ZGI0XkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjU4MzY0ODMtYmI1NS00NmZiLTllYjYtMjhjZTliODk1ZGI0XkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg","description":"1913, Budapest, in the heart of Europe as World War I approaches. The young Irisz Leiter arrives in the Hungarian capital with high hopes to work as a milliner at Leiter, the legendary hat store that once belonged to her late parents; but she is quickly sent away by the new owner, Oszkár Brill. While preparations are under way at the store, to host important, wealthy, royal guests, a man abruptly comes to Irisz, looking for a Kálmán Leiter, who he says is her brother. Refusing to leave the city, the young woman follows Kálmán's tracks, her only link to a lost past. Her quest brings her through the dark streets of Budapest, where only the Leiter hat store shines, into the turmoil of a civilization on the eve of its downfall."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3769837/","name":"Juli Jakab"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0412096/","name":"Vlad Ivanov"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm7257783/","name":"Evelin Dobos"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1841577/","name":"László Nemes"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0123200/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0143783/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0475594/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1841577/","name":"László Nemes"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6600340/","name":"Clara Royer"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3093523/","name":"Matthieu Taponier"}],"duration":"PT2H22M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Sole
Sole
programme.desc: Sole: Directed by Carlo Sironi. With Claudio Segaluscio, Sandra Drzymalska, Bruno Buzzi, Marco Felli. Lena is seven months pregnant and she's ready to sell the baby in her belly. Ermanno agrees to pretend to be the father. Fabio, the uncle of Ermanno, will pay them to buy the child that he and his wife Bianca cannot have. A fake adoption between relatives, a loophole to bypass the law cause in Italy the surrogate motherhood is forbidden. A world in which money is the only standard of value, the only thing that matter. Ermanno and Lena are two strangers that must pretend in public to be a couple and live together until the delivery. They are used to only think about themselves and they fight all the time. But living side by side they start becoming what they were only pretending to be." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt9648994/","name":"Sole","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWYwMjI2YjUtMzAyOS00YWViLWJiY2UtYzcwZTliYjk5YTRlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMzMxMDgxNjc@._V1_.jpg","description":"Lena is seven months pregnant and she's ready to sell the baby in her belly. programme.title: Na strajk!
programme.desc: Dzień z życia 19-letniego Karola, który opiekuje się dziadkiem chorym na alzheimera. Niebawem chłopak poznaje tajemnicę rodzinną związaną z dramatycznymi wydarzeniami podczas stoczniowych strajków w grudniu 1970 roku. Odkryta przeszłość zmusza go do podjęcia najważniejszej decyzji w życiu.

credits.actor: Jadwiga Jankowska-Cieślak
Witold Dębicki
Jan Peszek
Jędrzej Wielecki

programme.title: We mnie
programme.desc: Sandra (Małgorzata Gorol) świętuje swój wieczór panieński. Zbliża się dzień ślubu, ale przedtem musi poddać się aborcji - płód ma wady genetyczne. Do szpitala jedzie z nią narzeczony. Z każdą kolejną minutą mężczyzna wydaje się Sandrze coraz bardziej obcy. Po zabiegu kobieta postanawia szczerze z nim porozmawiać.

credits.actor: Małgorzata Gorol
Julian Świeżewski
Dorota Lulka
Krzysztof Stasierowski
Aneta Gołębiewska-Bussold
Diana Zamojska
Hanna Łubieńska
Jakub Nosiadek
Aleksandra Derda

programme.title: II koncert na wiolonczelę i orkiestrę
programme.desc: Pasją okulisty Macieja Gasika jest muzyka. W trakcie jednego z koncertów mężczyzna doznaje udaru mózgu. Staje się więźniem własnego ciała. Postanawia się nie poddawać i zawalczyć o swoją godność oraz wolność. Film na podstawie prawdziwej historii. Scenariusz stworzono do koncertu wiolonczelowego Pawła Mykietyna.

credits.actor: Piotr Kramer
Dorota Bzdyla
Maciej Stuhr
Jan Englert
Magdalena Popławska
Damian Mirga
Szymon Milas
Sebastian Figat
Kaja Kozłowska

programme.title: Rykoszety
programme.desc: Polska, 1982 rok. Nastroje społeczne stają się coraz bardziej napięte. Dwóch braci, będących górnikami, ma odmienne zdanie dotyczące postawy, jaką należy przyjąć w obliczu komunistycznego systemu. Janek (Stanisław Linowski) angażuje się w działania podziemia na rzecz demokracji. Tadek (Tomasz Schuchardt) natomiast woli zachować neutralność. Między mężczyznami pogłębia się konflikt.

programme.title: Dolapo jest OK
programme.desc: Wielka Brytania. Młoda czarnoskóra kobieta ma wkrótce zakończyć naukę w szkole z internatem i wkroczyć na rynek pracy. Spotyka się z presją, by zmienić nazwisko oraz swoją naturalną fryzurę.

programme.title: Den skyldige
Nieposłuszni
The Public
programme.desc: Den skyldige: Directed by Gustav Möller. With Jakob Cedergren, Jessica Dinnage, Omar Shargawi, Johan Gotthardt Olsen. A police officer assigned alarm dispatch duty enters a race against time when he answers an emergency call from a kidnapped woman." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt6742252/","name":"Den skyldige","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTk4MjEzYjctZmY2MS00ZDgyLWFkNDUtOTIyNDkwZjRlY2ZjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODAzODU1NDQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"A police officer assigned alarm dispatch duty enters a race against time when he answers an emergency call from a kidnapped woman.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6742252/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"asifahsankhan"},"dateCreated":"2018-11-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"How come Danish films are often just so good?","reviewBody":"In the vein of Locke, this super low-budget but effective thriller had me on the edge of my seat. It had the appropriate twists and turns to keep the audience guessing. It played with my emotions and had me in tears. How come Danish films are often just so good?\n\nUnfolding in real time, this immediately involving story bends and turns in surprising, sometimes horrifying ways. Enriched by Oskar Skriver's marvelous sound editing, which takes us from a speeding van to a bloodcurdling crime scene with equal authenticity, the movie smoothly blends police procedural with character study. What's happening on the end of Asger's phone line is gripping enough, but what's happening inside his head - illuminated by Jasper Spanning's almost abusive close-ups - is every bit as fascinating.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":52899,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.5},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Crime","Drama","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2018-06-14","keywords":"kidnapping,emergency telephone call,police dispatcher,single location,police","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi875019033","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTUwOGI1NWYtNDBiZS00MjdjLThlNWUtZWExMzQxM2M4ODIzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTUwOGI1NWYtNDBiZS00MjdjLThlNWUtZWExMzQxM2M4ODIzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A police officer assigned alarm dispatch duty enters a race against time when he answers an emergency call from a kidnapped woman."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0147767/","name":"Jakob Cedergren"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm7792072/","name":"Jessica Dinnage"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1494245/","name":"Omar Shargawi"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm7546166/","name":"Gustav Möller"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0529082/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0095264/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0048411/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm7546166/","name":"Gustav Möller"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3764055/","name":"Emil Nygaard Albertsen"}],"duration":"PT1H25M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 6742252, Title: Den skyldige, --- Description: Den skyldige: Directed by Gustav Möller. With Jakob Cedergren, Jessica Dinnage, Omar Shargawi, Johan Gotthardt Olsen. A police officer assigned alarm dispatch duty enters a race against time when he answers an emergency call from a kidnapped woman." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt6742252/","name":"Den skyldige","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTk4MjEzYjctZmY2MS00ZDgyLWFkNDUtOTIyNDkwZjRlY2ZjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODAzODU1NDQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"A police officer assigned alarm dispatch duty enters a race against time when he answers an emergency call from a kidnapped woman.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6742252/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"asifahsankhan","dateCreated":"2018-11-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"How come Danish films are often just so good?","reviewBody":"In the vein of Locke, this super low-budget but effective thriller had me on the edge of my seat. It had the appropriate twists and turns to keep the audience guessing. It played with my emotions and had me in tears. How come Danish films are often just so good?\n\nUnfolding in real time, this immediately involving story bends and turns in surprising, sometimes horrifying ways. Enriched by Oskar Skriver's marvelous sound editing, which takes us from a speeding van to a bloodcurdling crime scene with equal authenticity, the movie smoothly blends police procedural with character study. programme.title: Roads
Rocks
programme.desc: Roads: Directed by Sebastian Schipper. With Fionn Whitehead, Stéphane Bak, Ben Chaplin, Moritz Bleibtreu. Two lost teenage boys, from Congo and Britain, meet in Morocco and take a road trip in a stolen RV to France, encountering poverty and refugees on the way." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt7303530/","name":"Roads","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BM2RiN2IyY2QtYjU4ZC00MjM0LTkwMjUtZjVlOTBlNjgzYmJlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjE2ODIzMTA@._V1_.jpg","description":"Two lost teenage boys, from Congo and Britain, meet in Morocco and take a road trip in a stolen RV to France, encountering poverty and refugees on the way.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt7303530/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"SlightlyMe"},"dateCreated":"2019-12-10","inLanguage":"English","name":"A very slow burning self realisation road trip, best avoided.","reviewBody":"I started looking at my watch about a 3rd of the way through. Mostly this film is slow, bleak and dark. There's sparse humor, there's drama, there are some delicate moments but mostly lots of the monotony of travelling peppered with forgettable micro adventures and dialogue that is slow and dull, and so much of it. Lots of dark night time scenes. The character Fionn Whitehead plays (Gyllen) is hard to believe, troubled and irrationally irrational, topped by the performance of Stéphane Bak (William). A redeeming factor is the perspective of the immigrant poverty and hardships in the north of france. I'd say avoid.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":3}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":739,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4},"genre":["Adventure","Drama"],"datePublished":"2019-05-30","keywords":"road movie,male bonding,teenage boy,refugee,rv","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm7887725/","name":"Fionn Whitehead"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5255211/","name":"Stéphane Bak"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001035/","name":"Ben Chaplin"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0771923/","name":"Sebastian Schipper"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0660230/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0061958/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0164664/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0771923/","name":"Sebastian Schipper"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2047699/","name":"Oliver Ziegenbalg"}],"duration":"PT1H39M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Paul Newman: Błękitne oczy Hollywood
programme.desc: Bożyszcze światowego kina, Paul Newman, zasłynął licznymi kreacjami aktorskimi. Przeszedł do historii jako Butch Cassidy, nieugięty Luke, Rocky Graziano i Hud Bannon. Twórcy filmu przestawiają bogate dossier artysty, i to nie tylko aktorskie, ale też reżyserskie i producenckie. Poza tym opowiadają o życiu prywatnym Newmana. Pokazują go jako ojca, obywatela oraz pasjonata motoryzacji.

programme.title: Incident at Loch Ness
Incydent w Loch Ness
Incident at Loch Ness
programme.desc: Incident at Loch Ness: Directed by Zak Penn. With Werner Herzog, Kitana Baker, Gabriel Beristain, Russell Williams II. A documentary exploring the myth of the Loch Ness monster." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0374639/","name":"Incident at Loch Ness","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjE2OTUwMTYzN15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNzA4MDcyMQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A documentary exploring the myth of the Loch Ness monster.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0374639/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"streabbog"},"dateCreated":"2006-08-26","inLanguage":"English","name":"If you like unfunny comedies, then you'll enjoy this.","reviewBody":"The acting is so self-conscious and terrible (especially the bald guy), Werner Herzog is completely annoying (he reminded me of the equally annoying Wim Wenders), and the story is just stupid; however, all of this wouldn't have mattered if it had been FUNNY. Even the outtakes on the DVD are UNFUNNY! Herzog's "WOYZEK" has more laughs than this (I hope I got the point across about how unfunny this film is...) I grudgingly admit that Herzog was actually the best actor in the film. Despite how irritating he was, he did seem very natural (so I guess he's just naturally that annoying--but not as annoying as that bald guy!) If you like unfunny comedies, then this is the perfect film for you."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":4105,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Adventure","Comedy","Fantasy"],"datePublished":"2004-09-17","keywords":"inverness scotland,fake cryptozoologist,wonderland avenue los angeles,year 2003,boat engine","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001348/","name":"Werner Herzog"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1128564/","name":"Kitana Baker"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0075244/","name":"Gabriel Beristain"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0672015/","name":"Zak Penn"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0156805/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0672015/","name":"Zak Penn"}],"duration":"PT1H34M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Les ailes de la colombe
Skrzydła gołębicy
Les ailes de la colombe
programme.desc: Les ailes de la colombe: Directed by Benoît Jacquot. With Isabelle Huppert, Dominique Sanda, Michele Placido, Loleh Bellon. A mature lady approaches a young actor and offers him a great amount of money to get acquainted with her lonely daughter, who suffers of an incurable illness. Eventually a true romance emerges, as mother has secret feelings for the man, while he truly falls in love with the daughter. After the expected death of the daughter, the man leaves in grief rejecting the money, and the mature woman stays in deep loneliness, trying to cope with a double loss." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0155479/","name":"Les ailes de la colombe","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDVjMTYzYTYtNmJlOS00NmNjLTg1YWEtOWUyZTUyOTM2YTRmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMzU0NzkwMDg@._V1_.jpg","description":"A mature lady approaches a young actor and offers him a great amount of money to get acquainted with her lonely daughter, who suffers of an incurable illness. After the expected death of the daughter, the man leaves in grief rejecting the money, and the mature woman stays in deep loneliness, trying to cope with a double loss." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0155479/","name":"Les ailes de la colombe","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDVjMTYzYTYtNmJlOS00NmNjLTg1YWEtOWUyZTUyOTM2YTRmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMzU0NzkwMDg@._V1_.jpg","description":"A mature lady approaches a young actor and offers him a great amount of money to get acquainted with her lonely daughter, who suffers of an incurable illness. programme.title: Donnie Brasco
Donnie Brasco
programme.desc:
Donnie Brasco: Directed by Mike Newell. With Al Pacino, Johnny Depp, Michael Madsen, Bruno Kirby. An FBI undercover agent infiltrates the mob and finds himself identifying more with the mafia life, at the expense of his regular one." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0119008/","name":"Donnie Brasco","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzMzMDZkYWEtODIzNS00YjI3LTkxNTktOWEyZGM3ZWI2MWM4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzkwMjQ5NzM@._V1_.jpg","description":"An FBI undercover agent infiltrates the mob and finds himself identifying more with the mafia life, at the expense of his regular one.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0119008/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"heisenberg12"},"dateCreated":"2020-06-15","inLanguage":"English","name":"Absorbing, Understated Mafia Drama Due to the Genre's Most Popular Hits","reviewBody":"This is an absorbing film based on a true story about how Joe Pistone, an FBI agent, infiltrated the mafia in the 1970s in New York City.

It is the first modern era film that is based on this kind of infiltration. Since Donnie Brasco, many movies have used this same formula using an undercover agent to partake in organized crime takedowns, but it was really Donnie Brasco that started, or at least rejuvenated, this form of the genre.

The only reason I can think that it is only a 7.7 on IMDB is probably because this mafia genre has incredibly high expectations for it with the likes of The Godfather(s), Goodfellas, and even Heat. It doesn't pack the punch that those movies have and is more subdued in its delivery, but the pacing is impeccable and there is barely a moment in the entire runtime that is even a momentary letdown, which is rare. Donnie Brasco goes in a different direction than these films, focusing distinctly on the impact the job has on Joe Pistone's marriage, as well as the relationship he unionizes with "Lefty", in a groundbreaking role by Al Pacino, who plays an over-the-hill, stagnated, and somewhat desperate, made mafia member who feels unappreciated and disrespected to a level that deep down inside he wants out of it.

Not only are the performances all solid throughout, particularly from Pacino, Ann Hesche, Michael Madsen, and Depp, but the writing is excellent and the musical score is emotionally stunning. Anyone who is a fan of the genre or classic movies in general will definitely not regret watching Donnie Brasco, a top 25 movie here. It's a 9/10, but I'm giving it a 10/10 since compared with what the average movie is today or in the past twenty years, Donnie Brasco is way above them in heart, originality, execution, and acting talent.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":292163,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.7},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Biography","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"1997-02-28","keywords":"mafia,fbi agent,money,cutting off a leg,racial slur","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Donnie Brasco: Extended Cut","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3768189721","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGY2M2NiY2ItMDNjMC00NDE2LWJkZjYtZTA0ZDEyODBiM2RkXkEyXkFqcGdeQWVyZ3JlZW5l._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGY2M2NiY2ItMDNjMC00NDE2LWJkZjYtZTA0ZDEyODBiM2RkXkEyXkFqcGdeQWVyZ3JlZW5l._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Sony Pictures Home Entertainment"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000199/","name":"Al Pacino"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000136/","name":"Johnny Depp"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000514/","name":"Michael Madsen"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001565/","name":"Mike Newell"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0033437/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0038108/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0013696/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0685587/","name":"Joseph D. Pistone"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0940361/","name":"Richard Woodley"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001921/","name":"Paul Attanasio"}],"duration":"PT2H7M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Cthulhu
Cthulhu
programme.desc: Cthulhu: Directed by Dan Gildark. With Jason Cottle, Casey Curran, Ethan Atkinson, Patrick McKnight. A Seattle history professor, drawn back to his estranged family on the Oregon coast to execute his late mother's estate, is reaquainted with his best friend from childhood, with whom he has a long-awaited tryst. Caught in an accelerating series of events, he discovers aspects of his father's New Age cult which take on a dangerous and apocalyptic significance." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0478126/","name":"Cthulhu","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ4NTMzMDkyMV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwODExNzI5MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A Seattle history professor, drawn back to his estranged family on the Oregon coast to execute his late mother's estate, is reaquainted with his best friend from childhood, with whom he has a long-awaited tryst. Caught in an accelera","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0478126/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"roboto-arigato"},"dateCreated":"2008-08-15","inLanguage":"English","name":"The Thing That Should Not Be","reviewBody":"This is a terrible adaptation of H.P. Lovecraft's "The Shadow Over Innsmouth." The acting was weak, the direction was weak, and the original content has been butchered. I saw this movie at the Seattle International Film Festival, and that was the worst mistake I made all weekend. If you want to see a film based on "Shadow Over Innsmouth," Stuart Gordon's "Dagon" is mediocre, but it's certainly better than this botched attempt. If you want to see "Call of Cthulhu," the silent film adaptation is great. But this? This film is a waste of time. I suspect the people who are writing 10 out of 10 scores are either friends of the director or shills who worked on the film. There is no earthly way this film is a 10. It stinks like a rotten pile of fish.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":1}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":2067,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.6},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama","Horror","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2019-12-11","keywords":"cult,shower,gay kiss,male rear nudity,drugged sex","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Cthulhu","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3067805977","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BY2RmMzQyM2YtMmViZS00MWU3LWE2MmItNjBiY2YyODg1M2E0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BY2RmMzQyM2YtMmViZS00MWU3LWE2MmItNjBiY2YyODg1M2E0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from Arkham Northwest Production LLC"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0183039/","name":"Jason Cottle"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2699332/","name":"Casey Curran"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1915690/","name":"Ethan Atkinson"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2031220/","name":"Dan Gildark"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0158753/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0211451/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2032953/","name":"Grant Cogswell"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2031220/","name":"Dan Gildark"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0522454/","name":"H.P. If you want to see "Call of Cthulhu," the silent film adaptation is great. But this? This film is a waste of time. I suspect the people who are writing 10 out of 10 scores are either friends of the director or shills who worked on the film. There is no earthly way this film is a 10. It stinks like a rotten pile of fish.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":1,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":2067,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.6,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama","Horror","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2019-12-11","keywords":"cult,shower,gay kiss,male rear nudity,drugged sex","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Cthulhu","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3067805977","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BY2RmMzQyM2YtMmViZS00MWU3LWE2MmItNjBiY2YyODg1M2E0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BY2RmMzQyM2YtMmViZS00MWU3LWE2MmItNjBiY2YyODg1M2E0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from Arkham Northwest Production LLC","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0183039/","name":"Jason Cottle","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2699332/","name":"Casey Curran","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1915690/","name":"Ethan Atkinson"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2031220/","name":"Dan Gildark"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0158753/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0211451/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2032953/","name":"Grant Cogswell","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2031220/","name":"Dan Gildark","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0522454/","name":"H.P. programme.title: Deadly Swarm
Krwiożerczy rój
Deadly Swarm
programme.desc:
Deadly Swarm: Directed by Paul Andresen. With Shane Brolly, Kaarina Aufranc, J. Patrick McCormack, Pepe Serna. A lunatic scientist unleashes a swarm of killer wasps on an unsuspecting town. As the body count rises, one man emerges as the town's only hope for survival." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0303773/","name":"Deadly Swarm","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzg0ZDhkY2EtZmYxOS00MzkzLWFlYzgtNDIyNzM0OWExZGZmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMzU0NzkwMDg@._V1_.jpg","description":"A lunatic scientist unleashes a swarm of killer wasps on an unsuspecting town. As the body count rises, one man emerges as the town's only hope for survival.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0303773/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ExpendableMan"},"dateCreated":"2007-07-22","inLanguage":"English","name":"Buzz buzz mothertrucker","reviewBody":"In some respects, I've always felt a little sorry for town mayors in films like "The Deadly Swarm." Ever since Jaws, they've been depicted as greedy Capitalist entrepreneurs that readily ignore the sensible advice of the scientist/cop/journalist/sexy teens who know about the rapidly approaching ferocious monster(s) for the sake of chasing those delicious American dollars. Call it crazy, but I've always felt a twinge of sympathy for them, they are just trying to do their jobs and protects local economic interests at a time of tremendous cultural importance. However, none have tugged at my heart strings quite like the Mayor in this film.

Here is a man who we are supposed to despise, but when we first meet him, he is asking the hero (an insect specialist this time around) how the job of solving the mosquito problem is going. Rather than saying "yeah, I've killed them all with my fancy insect-specialist stuff," the response is more along the lines of: "well, I'm bringing thousands more mosquito's into the neighbouring countryside. Oh, and some bats too." The movie then expects us an audience to condemn the mayor when he makes the logical step of firing the man, enchanting though his eyes may be and telling him to get out of town. All because he's fat, wearing a designer shirt and smoking a cigar. Lousy successful people! How dare they occupy positions of office! 

Fast forward about twenty five minutes and the Mayor now has the town's police chief sat before him. When asked whether the previously mentioned insect specialist has been thrown out of town, the sheriff doesn't say: "yes of course mayor, he's well on his way to the border." No, instead, the reply this time is more like: "no, actually I've been hanging out with him for the past few hours and done nothing but blow up the city morgue because it had a bit of a wasp problem." Just like before, we are expected to applaud this decision and cheer on the honest lawman for not giving in to the reasonable demands made of him. But surely shelling out for a can of Raid would do? 

Fast forward even more and for the third time in the movie, we are expected to condone the mayor. The reason this time? Simple, a large group of men in military uniforms have turned up with a very polite man and lots of expensive looking equipment, claiming to be from an environmental protection agency. Yet again, the mayor tells the good natured old sheriff to deal with the rugged hero. He's a loose cannon! A wild card! For all we know, he could be siding with the bees! From the tone of the scene, it's quite obvious that we should be shaking our fists with rage at the mayor's foolish decisions but let's be fair now...the only reason he's willing to trust this new group is because they look like professionals, act like professionals, haven't blown up any of the town and haven't said "actually, we're here to carry out an evil plan." Needless to say then, this is not a great movie when it comes to even-handed depictions of public officials. Though to be honest now, films about swarms of killer bees which have remote Guatemalan tribesmen speaking fluent Castellan Spanish probably didn't spend much time on the script. "The Deadly Swarm" is a terrible movie, the only reason I'm giving it two stars is because at one bit, a UFO nut starts firing a shotgun wildly into the swarm while shouting "Nobody's probing my rectum!" Don't even rent this one folks.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":2}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":358,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":3.4},"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Action","Horror","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2003-07-05","keywords":"natural horror,creature feature,wasp,swarm,killer wasp","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0111274/","name":"Shane Brolly"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0041769/","name":"Kaarina Aufranc"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0566445/","name":"J. Patrick McCormack"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1013712/","name":"Paul Andresen"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0075392/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0017447/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0102301/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1260469/","name":"John Dombrow"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5179453/","name":"William H. Stewart"}],"duration":"PT1H30M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Dominion
Dominion
programme.desc:
Dominion: Created by Vaun Wilmott. With Christopher Egan, Tom Wisdom, Roxanne McKee, Luke Allen-Gale. Follows the perilous journey of a rebellious young soldier who discovers he's the unlikely savior of humanity." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt3079768/","name":"Dominion","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ4NDcyMzI3OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDc3ODc1MzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Follows the perilous journey of a rebellious young soldier who discovers he's the unlikely savior of humanity.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3079768/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"lmahesa"},"dateCreated":"2014-06-20","inLanguage":"English","name":"A promising followup to Legion","reviewBody":"First a disclaimer: I have no desire to be a movie critic, and I auto-avoid 'user' reviews made by wannabe critics who like to drop impressive words to show of their knowledge of the dictionary. So, I won't.

Now, here's a secondary disclaimer. I *ENJOYED* the movie 'Legion', and I had resigned myself to not getting a sequel made. A TV series? Better. Much, much better. TV gives an idea room to breathe and evolve over time.

This series took me by surprise, as I hadn't heard about it before. As soon as I finished watching the pilot, I immediately dug out Legion and watched that again. The series is entirely a continuation of the movie, set some years after. The plot makes sense, and the densely packed pilot served to set the scene very well. Then again, I watch for entertainment and don't go looking for errors, so your mileage may vary.

The set, costumes and props are all of a high standard, and there wasn't anything that caught your eye as being out of place or of poor quality. The CGI was very good, with the exception of one high-speed death scene near the beginning which flits by so fast many of you won't notice it.

There is a lot of implied sensuality, though (so far) nothing pornographic other than one costume. I feel they found a good balance there, without being crass for the sake of it.

Now, the acting. I've seen a number of shows featuring Anthony Head (David Whele), and this is his crowning achievement, I believe. In one episode, he gets you to hate him, sympathize with him, pity him... twice I flipped, from rooting against him to siding with him and back again. All this was achieved in a relatively low number of scenes. He isn't the soft touch we've become used to seeing him portray. The love interest, Claire (Roxanne McKee) has shown better abilities than Alex the lead (Christopher Egan) though I think it won't be long before he finds his place once his 'role' in the story is more firm. Casting there was an excellent choice - she even looks like her on-screen father, Alan Dale.

So far, after one episode, this has killed Defiance as it is truly Fantasy/SF, instead of just a Western with SF bits stapled on. Also, it's not a formulaic, monster-of-the-week or crime-of-the-week show... you'll have to follow to keep up.

That makes it expensive, though, and a risk for the studio.

Now. This is SyFy. Call me jaded, but the odds of this not getting canned after one or two seasons aren't great.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":23221,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8},"contentRating":"TV-MA","genre":["Action","Drama","Fantasy"],"datePublished":"2014-06-19","keywords":"archangel,soldier,infidelity,foursome,orgy","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0250659/","name":"Christopher Egan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0936300/","name":"Tom Wisdom"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1861467/","name":"Roxanne McKee"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0135575/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0086397/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0242101/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2477757/","name":"Vaun Wilmott"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1866969113","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjIxMzA0MDkzNl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjQ1NDkxNjE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjIxMzA0MDkzNl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjQ1NDkxNjE@._V1_.jpg","description":"The second season of Syfy's Dominion premieres on Thursday, July 9th."}}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 3079768, Title: Dominion, --- Description: Dominion: Created by Vaun Wilmott. With Christopher Egan, Tom Wisdom, Roxanne McKee, Luke Allen-Gale. Follows the perilous journey of a rebellious young soldier who discovers he's the unlikely savior of humanity." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt3079768/","name":"Dominion","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ4NDcyMzI3OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDc3ODc1MzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Follows the perilous journey of a rebellious young soldier who discovers he's the unlikely savior of humanity.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3079768/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"lmahesa","dateCreated":"2014-06-20","inLanguage":"English","name":"A promising followup to Legion","reviewBody":"First a disclaimer: I have no desire to be a movie critic, and I auto-avoid 'user' reviews made by wannabe critics who like to drop impressive words to show of their knowledge of the dictionary. So, I won't.

Now, here's a secondary disclaimer. I *ENJOYED* the movie 'Legion', and I had resigned myself to not getting a sequel made. A TV series? Better. Much, much better. TV gives an idea room to breathe and evolve over time.

This series took me by surprise, as I hadn't heard about it before. As soon as I finished watching the pilot, I immediately dug out Legion and watched that again. The series is entirely a continuation of the movie, set some years after. The plot makes sense, and the densely packed pilot served to set the scene very well. Then again, I watch for entertainment and don't go looking for errors, so your mileage may vary.

The set, costumes and props are all of a high standard, and there wasn't anything that caught your eye as being out of place or of poor quality. The CGI was very good, with the exception of one high-speed death scene near the beginning which flits by so fast many of you won't notice it.

There is a lot of implied sensuality, though (so far) nothing pornographic other than one costume. I feel they found a good balance there, without being crass for the sake of it.

Now, the acting. I've seen a number of shows featuring Anthony Head (David Whele), and this is his crowning achievement, I believe. In one episode, he gets you to hate him, sympathize with him, pity him... twice I flipped, from rooting against him to siding with him and back again. All this was achieved in a relatively low number of scenes. He isn't the soft touch we've become used to seeing him portray. The love interest, Claire (Roxanne McKee) has shown better abilities than Alex the lead (Christopher Egan) though I think it won't be long before he finds his place once his 'role' in the story is more firm. Casting there was an excellent choice - she even looks like her on-screen father, Alan Dale.

So far, after one episode, this has killed Defiance as it is truly Fantasy/SF, instead of just a Western with SF bits stapled on. Also, it's not a formulaic, monster-of-the-week or crime-of-the-week show... you'll have to follow to keep up.

That makes it expensive, though, and a risk for the studio.

Now. This is SyFy. Call me jaded, but the odds of this not getting canned after one or two seasons aren't great.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":23221,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8,"contentRating":"TV-MA","genre":["Action","Drama","Fantasy"],"datePublished":"2014-06-19","keywords":"archangel,soldier,infidelity,foursome,orgy","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0250659/","name":"Christopher Egan","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0936300/","name":"Tom Wisdom","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1861467/","name":"Roxanne McKee"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0135575/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0086397/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0242101/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2477757/","name":"Vaun Wilmott"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1866969113","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjIxMzA0MDkzNl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjQ1NDkxNjE@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjIxMzA0MDkzNl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjQ1NDkxNjE@._V1_.jpg","description":"The second season of Syfy's Dominion premieres on Thursday, July 9th."</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Sharknado 3: Oh Hell No
Rekinado 3: O rybia płetwa
Sharknado 3: Oh Hell No!
programme.desc: Sharknado 3: Oh Hell No!: Directed by Anthony C. Ferrante. With Ian Ziering, Tara Reid, Cassandra Scerbo, Frankie Muniz. A monstrous tornado unleashes ravenous sharks from Washington, D.C., all the way down to Orlando, Florida." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt3899796/","name":"Sharknado 3: Oh Hell No!","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTc5MDUzNzQzOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDg4NTYzNTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A monstrous tornado unleashes ravenous sharks from Washington, D.C., all the way down to Orlando, Florida.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3899796/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"keithlovesmovies"},"dateCreated":"2015-07-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Sharknado 3 Review","reviewBody":"Fin (Ian Ziering) and April (Tara Reid) are now remarried and are expecting another child. After a trip to Washington D.C. to receive a medal from current president Marcus Robbins (Marc Cuban) for his heroic actions during the events in the first 2 films, another sharknado strikes destroying the capital. Fearing that his family is in danger, he heads to Orlando. What he doesn't know is that a sharknado is following him while another is attacking Orlando. Now he and those he runs into on the way to Orlando must work together to try to stop the sharknados before they combine to form a sharkicane with the potential to destroy the entire East Coast.\n\nI'll get right to it and say that this movie is terrible but that's not the point here. Everyone probably knew this coming in so I don't think that I'm surprising anyone. The acting is bad, the special effects are bad to the point that they are laughable, and the story doesn't make any sense. I am aware that this movie is called Sharknado 3 so I wasn't expecting anything scientifically accurate. Sharks in space people!!!! I saw some things in this that made me question myself but like I've said, this film is called Sharknado 3 so in order to enjoy it, you just have to suspend belief and accept what you are being given. My favorite thing about the film is all the random shark kills in all their "semi-gory" glory (this is a TV movie so they can only go so far). You'll also be surprised by some of the people who get killed (no spoilers). Common sense would normally dictate not watching this but if you give it a chance you'll be pleasantly surprised and perhaps entertained as I was. I've seen the first 2 films and I enjoyed them a lot and I think that this one is the best one so far.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":12465,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.1},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2015-07-22","keywords":"third part,creature feature,shark,space shuttle,nasa","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Sharknado 3: Oh Hell No!","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3641750297","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDFjYzAzMmItODRmMy00NWZjLWJkYjgtNmVjY2Y2ZDVlNDIwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDFjYzAzMmItODRmMy00NWZjLWJkYjgtNmVjY2Y2ZDVlNDIwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Sharknado 3: Oh Hell No!"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005575/","name":"Ian Ziering"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005346/","name":"Tara Reid"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2628561/","name":"Cassandra Scerbo"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0003116/","name":"Anthony C. Ferrante"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0282285/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0042909/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0705757/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0505736/","name":"Thunder Levin"}],"duration":"PT1H33M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Stranger Than Fiction
Przypadek Harolda Cricka
Stranger Than Fiction
programme.desc:
Stranger Than Fiction: Directed by Marc Forster. With Will Ferrell, William Dick, Guy Massey, Martha Espinoza. I.R.S. auditor Harold Crick suddenly finds his mundane Chicago life to be the subject of narration only he can hear: narration that begins to affect his entire existence, from his work to his love life to his death." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0420223/","name":"Stranger Than Fiction","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmE2ZjYwNGYtYWMyMS00M2I0LWI4NDEtMzc1MTllMjk0ZmFmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTIzOTk5ODM@._V1_.jpg","description":"I.R.S. auditor Harold Crick suddenly finds his mundane Chicago life to be the subject of narration only he can hear: narration that begins to affect his entire existence, from his work to his love life to his death.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0420223/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"WriterDave"},"dateCreated":"2006-11-19","inLanguage":"English","name":"Detailed, Astute, Eclectic, and Entertaining Pseudo-Comedy","reviewBody":""Stranger than Fiction" is the complex tale of a simple IRS man named Harold Crick (an appealing Will Ferrel) who one day awakes to his own voice-over narration only to find he is the unwitting main character in the new tragic novel from acclaimed author Karen Eiffel (an excellent return to form for Emma Thompson). Imagine a Charlie Kaufman penned film where all the cynicism and nihilism is replaced with an endearing and heartfelt melancholy that creates a surprising amount of emotional involvement in characters who would've otherwise been over-reaching literacy devices, and you'll get a feel for the sincere type of entertainment Marc Forster's film provides.

Forster, with his keen eye and eclectic visual sense, populates the film the sharp and contrasting visual angles, camera tricks, and in-frame oddities (like the play with numbers) constantly keeping the viewer engaged and on their toes. Fun supporting turns from Dustin Hoffman as a literary theorist employed by Krick to help find out if the story he is in is a comedy or tragedy, and Queen Latifah as Eiffel's no-nonsense publishing assistant help guide the viewers through imaginative stretches that are occasionally too clever by half. Ferrel gets to show some nice range here, and much like Robin Williams did with "The World According to Garp" and Jim Carrey did with "The Truman Show," graduates with honors into more high-minded quasi-serious roles. His co-lead Thompson is subtly method and well studied as the reclusive sociopathic author who just can't help killing her characters.

What really seals the deal is Maggie Gyllenhal as Farrell's love interest, the anti-establishment baker he is assigned to audit. She literally lights up the screen. There's one expertly framed and perfectly lit shot of her standing outside her townhouse inviting Farrel in for the night where the light from street lamp off screen is filtered in through the shadows of tree branches and hits her face in such a way that in that brief flickering frame you become insanely happy to be watching such a pleasant marriage of literary concepts inside a visual medium. At this point you don't care how the film ends. You're just grateful to experience that giddy moment of pure movie entertainment.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":224302,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.5},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Fantasy"],"datePublished":"2006-11-10","keywords":"author,fate,professor,novelist,writer","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Stranger Than Fiction","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2710241561","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYmRlZDQ1MjQtMjIwOS00YTE5LTg3MjQtNDU4ZTg1ZmI4MjA5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYmRlZDQ1MjQtMjIwOS00YTE5LTg3MjQtNDU4ZTg1ZmI4MjA5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Sony Pictures Home Entertainment"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0002071/","name":"Will Ferrell"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000668/","name":"Emma Thompson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000163/","name":"Dustin Hoffman"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0286975/","name":"Marc Forster"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0142446/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0183490/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1590998/","name":"Zach Helm"}],"duration":"PT1H53M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: DragonHeart
Ostatni smok
DragonHeart
programme.desc: DragonHeart: Directed by Rob Cohen. With Dennis Quaid, David Thewlis, Pete Postlethwaite, Dina Meyer. The last dragon and a disillusioned dragonslaying Knight must cooperate to stop an evil King, who was given partial immortality." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0116136/","name":"DragonHeart","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzI2NGUzYzAtY2Y1MS00NzhjLWFiYzItODgwM2RlN2M5ZjA4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjc1NTYyMjg@._V1_.jpg","description":"The last dragon and a disillusioned dragonslaying Knight must cooperate to stop an evil King, who was given partial immortality.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0116136/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Erik G."},"dateCreated":"1999-02-22","inLanguage":"English","name":"pretty good...","reviewBody":"Like others, I rate Dragonheart far above most mindless summer blockbusters, loaded with hip witticisms and sarcastic heroes. Dragonheart is not cynical at all, and is lots of fun for kids of all ages (why is this movie PG13?). If you're looking for a really ferocious dragon, Draco isn't it. Draco is much more human than most movie dragons (if you want a scary dragon, watch Dragonslayer), but he is very realistic. In fact, the scenes without him tend to drag, but Dennis Quaid's Bowen is strong as the disillusioned knight. If you are looking for a deep plot, you won't find it, but that's no big deal. Dragonheart is more about adventure and dragons than about plot twists and in depth characterizations. Edelman's music is great for the most part, especially in the final scenes, which I think are the best in the movie. IMDb data; ttnr: 0116136, Title: DragonHeart, --- Description: DragonHeart: Directed by Rob Cohen. With Dennis Quaid, David Thewlis, Pete Postlethwaite, Dina Meyer. The last dragon and a disillusioned dragonslaying Knight must cooperate to stop an evil King, who was given partial immortality." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0116136/","name":"DragonHeart","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzI2NGUzYzAtY2Y1MS00NzhjLWFiYzItODgwM2RlN2M5ZjA4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjc1NTYyMjg@._V1_.jpg","description":"The last dragon and a disillusioned dragonslaying Knight must cooperate to stop an evil King, who was given partial immortality.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0116136/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"Erik G.","dateCreated":"1999-02-22","inLanguage":"English","name":"pretty good...","reviewBody":"Like others, I rate Dragonheart far above most mindless summer blockbusters, loaded with hip witticisms and sarcastic heroes. Dragonheart is not cynical at all, and is lots of fun for kids of all ages (why is this movie PG13?). If you're looking for a really ferocious dragon, Draco isn't it. Draco is much more human than most movie dragons (if you want a scary dragon, watch Dragonslayer), but he is very realistic. In fact, the scenes without him tend to drag, but Dennis Quaid's Bowen is strong as the disillusioned knight. If you are looking for a deep plot, you won't find it, but that's no big deal. Dragonheart is more about adventure and dragons than about plot twists and in depth characterizations. Edelman's music is great for the most part, especially in the final scenes, which I think are the best in the movie. Check it out.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":95041,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5,"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Fantasy"],"datePublished":"1996-05-31","keywords":"dragon,king,knight,human dragon relationship,england","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Dragonheart","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3548882457","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMWMwMDI3MGEtMGVlYy00Y2ZlLWE2YjEtN2NkNGE4NGIxMWUxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMWMwMDI3MGEtMGVlYy00Y2ZlLWE2YjEtN2NkNGE4NGIxMWUxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer 2 for Dragonheart","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000598/","name":"Dennis Quaid","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000125/","name":"Sean Connery","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000539/","name":"Dina Meyer"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0003418/","name":"Rob Cohen"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0425957/","name":"Patrick Read Johnson","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0688279/","name":"Charles Edward Pogue"],"duration":"PT1H43M"</script><metacontent="

Children of Men

Children of Men: Directed by Alfonso Cuarón. With Juan Gabriel Yacuzzi, Mishal Husain, Rob Curling, Jon Chevalier. In 2027, in a chaotic world in which women have become somehow infertile, a former activist agrees to help transport a miraculously pregnant woman to a sanctuary at sea." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0206634/","name":"Children of Men","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ5NTI2NTI4NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNjk2NDA2OQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"In 2027, in a chaotic world in which women have become somehow infertile, a former activist agrees to help transport a miraculously pregnant woman to a sanctuary at sea.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0206634/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"blestang"},"dateCreated":"2006-10-25","inLanguage":"English","name":"a must see= brilliant and fresh","reviewBody":"this film is one of the best things i have seen this year. It's an improbable cross between "Brazil" "a clockwork orange" and the video game HALF-LIFE2 (from which it borrows it's final sequences and use of on shot action-sequences) it manages to be both entertaining in the Hollywood way (with incredible action sequences and a very clever way of using digital effects) yet very sad and different with a very very dark and realistic overtone. No comic relief, no cartoon character bravery, only human behavior in it's best and most horrible way. This realistic overtone makes the main characters very engaging and moving. CLive owen (whose i have always disliked) is excellent as the man drowned into an adventure too big for him (sorry for my bad English)

It's the same kind of film than V for vendetta (both taking place in a futuristic fascist British society) different from the usual mainstrean studio teenager pleaser crap

programme.title: Oblivion
Niepamięć
Oblivion
programme.desc: Oblivion: Directed by Joseph Kosinski. With Tom Cruise, Morgan Freeman, Olga Kurylenko, Andrea Riseborough. A veteran assigned to extract Earth's remaining resources begins to question what he knows about his mission and himself." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1483013/","name":"Oblivion","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQwMDY0MTA4MF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNzI3MDgxOQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A veteran assigned to extract Earth's remaining resources begins to question what he knows about his mission and himself.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1483013/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ollyc123"},"dateCreated":"2013-04-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"Fantastic visual effects ensure a gripping and entertaining film","reviewBody":"Before seeing this film in theaters it was tough to know what to expect. It immediately grasped my attention as the storyline was so different than anything I have seen as of late. Tom Cruise is the perfect man for the lead role, and does not fail to deliver a good performance. If you are a relatively simple person with a short attention span you may become a bit dazed and confused as to why certain components of the film are occurring, but it adds up in the end beyond measure. Although 'Oblivion' forces you to work slightly harder than usual in understanding the plot and each twist that it takes, it all comes together very well in this thrilling yet slightly confusing film. No doubt one of Kosinski's best so far.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":502907,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2013-04-19","keywords":"post apocalypse,drone,cabin in the woods,black and white scene,alien invasion","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Version 2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi498116121","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQzNzU4NDc1OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDU1NzgxOQ@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQzNzU4NDc1OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDU1NzgxOQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A court martial sends a veteran soldier to a distant planet, where he has to destroy the remains of an alien race. The arrival of an unexpected traveler causes him to question what he knows about the planet, his mission, and himself. The Scorpion King
programme.desc:
The Scorpion King: Directed by Chuck Russell. With Dwayne Johnson, Steven Brand, Michael Clarke Duncan, Kelly Hu. A desert warrior rises up against the evil army that is destroying his homeland. He captures the enemy's key sorcerer, takes her deep into the desert and prepares for a final showdown." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0277296/","name":"The Scorpion King","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjkxNTAwNTQ0M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwMTQwMjM3._V1_.jpg","description":"A desert warrior rises up against the evil army that is destroying his homeland. He captures the enemy's key sorcerer, takes her deep into the desert and prepares for a final showdown.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0277296/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"KissEnglishPasto"},"dateCreated":"2016-08-02","inLanguage":"English","name":"This Critter King Delivers Quite a Sting!","reviewBody":"From PASTO, COLOMBIA-Via: L. A. CA; CALI, COLOMBIA+ORLANDO, FL ---------------------The ONLY Tony Kiss Castillo on Facebook!------------

In the '80s and '90s, Arnold Scharzennegar was the King of Hollywood action films. But nothing is forever. With the The Scorpion King, there seems to be a new pretender to the throne ...The ROCK! More charismatic and certainly a better actor (but then again, who isn't?) Than "AHNULD" was 20 years ago, The Rock, here appearing in his first title role, has had the good fortune that the film, and his participation in it, seems to have been relatively successful in every sense of the word!

"Scorpion" from beginning to end, is a roller coaster of action, adventure, intrigue, romance, magic and beautiful women. A Hollywood capsule of pure adrenaline. If there is anyone in the family who does not like movies of this genre, hard not to be entertained by this minor gem. But Be forewarned! Scorpian may not be the most suitable of films for kids under 9 or 10..... But for all thosewho are 12 or over.... Definitely 2 Thumbs UP!

7.5********STARS*......ENJOY!/DISFRUTELA!

Any comments, questions or observations, in English o en Español, are most welcome!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":134558,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.5},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Fantasy"],"datePublished":"2002-04-19","keywords":"sorceress,desert,king,showdown,shared universe","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0425005/","name":"Dwayne Johnson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0104526/","name":"Steven Brand"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0003817/","name":"Michael Clarke Duncan"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0751080/","name":"Chuck Russell"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0049706/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0075836/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0814085/","name":"Stephen Sommers"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0355054/","name":"Jonathan Hales"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0651758/","name":"William Osborne"}],"duration":"PT1H32M"}</script><metacontent="

Than "AHNULD" was 20 years ago, The Rock, here appearing in his first title role, has had the good fortune that the film, and his participation in it, seems to have been relatively successful in every sense of the word!

"Scorpion" from beginning to end, is a roller coaster of action, adventure, intrigue, romance, magic and beautiful women. A Hollywood capsule of pure adrenaline. If there is anyone in the family who does not like movies of this genre, hard not to be entertained by this minor gem. But Be forewarned! Scorpian may not be the most suitable of films for kids under 9 or 10..... But for all thosewho are 12 or over.... Definitely 2 Thumbs UP!
